none: Letter to Louis L. McInnis from J. D. Lee, February 15, 1883
Letter to Louis L. McInnis from J. D. Lee, February 15, 1883
Box 1 Louis L. McInnis Papers/Box 1 Folder 13 Louis L. McInnis Papers
Agricultural and Mechanical College of Mississippi

en: Letter from S. D. Lee, President of the Agricultural and Mechanical College of Mississippi, to Professor Louis L. McInnis regarding the transmission of legislative committee reports to George Pfeuffer in Austin. Lee expresses optimism about McInnis's institution's success as an industrial college and notes that the Mississippi college has modeled itself after Michigan College. The letter reflects contemporary efforts to establish and develop agricultural and mechanical education in the post-Civil War South.

body.value:
[Header]

Agricultural and Mechanical College,
OF MISSISSIPPI.

Executive Department,
S. D. LEE, PRESIDENT.

Agricultural College, Feb'y 15" 1883

Prof L. L. McInnis
My dear Sir
At your request, I sent to
Honble Geo. Pfeuffer at Austin, a 1/2 dozen
copies of report of Legislative Committee &
wrote him to that effect - I do hope your
Legislature will give you ample appro-
priations and that you may eminently
succeed as an Industrial College - We
feel here that we are on the right road.
We modeled after the Michigan College
and think we are an improvement
With best wishes,

[Signature]

Yours truly
S. D. Lee

There's a dateline reading "Agricultural College, Feb'y 15" 1883." The letter is addressed to "Prof L.L. McInnis." The handwriting is cursive, a little hurried, which I'll keep in mind. Now I'm making a draft transcription. I'm noting the layout: * Header: "Agricultural and Mechanical College, OF MISSISSIPPI." * Box: "Executive Department, S.D. Pfeuffer at Austin, a 1/2 dozen copies of report of Legislative Committee & wrote him to that effect - I do hope your Legislature will give you ample appro- priations and that you may eminently succeed as an Industrial College - We feel here that we are on the right road. We modeled after the Michigan College and think we are an improvement With best wishes Yours truly S. D. Lee" I'm cross-referencing this to confirm the people and places mentioned. "L.L. McInnis" was a professor at Texas A&M. "Honble Geo. Pfeuffer" was a Texas legislator and A&M regent. This helps. Okay, the words look right. I'm noting that "appro-priations" is split over two lines, which must be preserved. And "Michigan College" likely refers to Michigan State, a model for these land-grant colleges. For formatting, I'll use `

` for paragraphs. The ornate header content isn't critical, so I can use standard text. I'll use `

Pfeuffer at Austin, a 1/2 dozen copies of report of Legislative Committee & wrote him to that effect - I do hope your Legislature will give you ample appro- priations and that you may eminently succeed as an Industrial College - We feel here that we are on the right road. We modeled after the Michigan College and think we are an improvement With best wishes, Yours truly S. D. Lee Now I check for the HTML constraints: a, b, br, i, img, p, small, span, sub, sup.
